name: Remove bootstrap_user.
body: Simpler, but losing a variable = new major version.

name: quoting.
body:
Fixes:
- Quote risky value

Features:
- Check for risky values.

name: Add community.general for apk and zypper.
Drop CentOS (7 and 8), introduce RockyLinux (8)
body: Since CentOS seems dead now, switch to RockyLinux. Centos 7 is not in full support anymore, and RockyLinux offer version 8 only.

name: Cleanup and up to date formats.
Argument specs!
body: Preparing to get rid of assert.yml and start using arguments specs.

name: Also use collections for modules in blocks.
Prepare for Fedora 32 and update docs/ci
Remove connection warning and update Molecule Action.
GitHub Action to release to Galaxy and aesthetics
Drop ArchLinux and SLES support, add Galaxy GitHub Action
Fix for platform version for SUSE
Refactor by rembik
body:
Thanks to @rembik, the role is a lot simpler to read and maintain.

A major version, because the `bootstrap_preview` variable is gone. The rest of the interface and functions remains the same.

name: Meta ansible version bump
body: Once again, thanks @rembik for your remark, the role works with Ansible 2.8 and up. Meta now reflects this information properly.

name: Less Debian & Ubuntu, remove duplicate block for amazon.
Test Ansible 2.8, 2.9 and devel, don't test Ansible 2.7 anymore.
Tox and fully generated CI & docs.
Fixes for RHEL and improved logic
body:
Thanks to @jellevandehaterd and @josesalvador for giving feedback and pull requests.

The world is now a little better place thanks to you!

This release allows Red Hat Enterprise Linux (7) installations, fixes openSUSE and improves logic.

name: Remove CentOS-6 support
body: This release drops CentOS/RHEL6 support and ensures CentOS/RHEL7 use python3.

name: More facts
body:
Some role running after this role need the more than the minimum set of ansible facts.

This release runs the full setup. It may take a few seconds longer to include the role, but all facts are required after running this role.

name: CentOS/RHEL 8 support
body:
This rewrite supports CentOS 8 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

The method to discover what to install has been changed from **package manager based** to **distribution characteristics based**. Feels like a more sturdy way to decide what to install.

name: Use python3 more.
body: Some distributions now use python3.

name: No more policycoreutils-python
body: More an SELinux dependency than a bootstrap dependency.

name: openSUSE fixed
body: openSUSE renamed the container name.

name: Faster and simpler
body: Well, that's a double win.

name: eastatics
body: Disable an allowed-to-fail test.

name: dnf python3
body:
- DNF uses python 3 now
- Red Hat UBI tests added.

name: Python 3 for Ubuntu
body:
This release fixes #26 

Ubuntu hosts will now get python-3 as suggested by @acrom18 .

@tlc suggests to use `bootstrap_raw_packages: "{{ ansible_python_interpreter | basename }}-minimal"`. That may be a good solution, I'm investigating.

Thanks for the help all!

name: Deprecation warning gone
body: And updated docs.

name: Re-release
body: The previous release contained a ci-skip statement, causing that release not te be tested.

name: Fedora 30 and i8n
body:
- Allow roles to run on Fedora 30. (You do need to [set `ansible_python_interpreter` on ansible 2.7](https://robertdebock.nl/2019/06/06/fedora-30-python3.html) and below)
- Set `LANG` to prevent grepping for different language output.
- Update documentation.

name: Fedora on Python 3
body: Fedora 30 and above now use Python 3 fully. This role has been changed to accommodate that.

name: Ansible 2.8
body:
- Test against Ansible 2.8
- Fix Kali
- Remove deprecation warning.

name: Retries
body: Are configurable now.

name: Nothing basically
body: Opensuse was failing, added debugging, async and remove them again. Basically back to what is was.

name: Slack notifications
body: They now work again!

name: ClearLinux and Kali
body:
Kali and ClearLinux now work again.
Removed a duplicate test.
Add "xz"/"xz-utils" to support the Ansible module `unarchive` to work.

name: Prepare
body: Molecule now uses `prepare.yml`, saving a bit of time on idempotency tests.

name: Forgotten things
body: A few (read: almost all) cleanups were forgotten in 3.0.0. This release cleans up the role further.

name: Cleanup-royal
body:
A lot of complexity has been removed from this role in order to make the role more readable and maintainable.

- `ara` integration is removed, I was not using it.
- `goss` integration has been removed, it's difficult to describe tests for multiple platforms and added test-time.
- `{{ role_name }}_ignore_docker` has been removed, it introduces more issues than it solves.
- `{{ role_name }}_package_state` has been removed, I've never used it.
- `README.md` has been updated with a new template.

A major release bump, because two variable have been removed, `{{ role_name }}_ignore_docker` and `{{ role_name }}_package_state`.

name: Tumbleweed no more
body: OpenSUSE renamed their Docker images. Testing now only runs on openSUSE Leap.

name: Refresh
body: Documentation and tests have been updated.

name: Archlinux
body: Archlinux changed it's image name from `base/archlinux` to `archlinux/base`. Quite logical.

name: Complexity in vars
body: Move the complexity into `vars/main.yml`.

name: Idempotency
body:
The role now checks the connection to decide what user to use for further tasks.

Thanks @rembik for you contribution, nice!

name: Kali Linux supported
body: Actually it was only required to test kali, the default already worked fine for Kali Linux, probably because it's Debian based.

name: Update docs
body: The docs have been updated to better explain how to lint.

name: metafix
body: OpenBSD meta data is correctly formatted now.

name: Network variable available
body: The network variables are available after installing this role. For example `ansible_default_ipv4` is used in many templates of other roles.

name: Title
body: Fix the title to be as short as possible, as long an necessary.

name: OpenBSD
body:
This release features compatibility with OpenBSD!

Thanks to @kmonticolo for your work.

name: Fedora bump
body: Tests on Fedora 29 now.

name: Retries
body: Reduced to 3, which all other roles use.

name: Rawhide
body: Fedora 30 switched to using more python3 and less python2. A package `python2-dnf` is missing from Fedora 30. This release allows for Fedora 30. For more information see [this post](https://robertdebock.nl/2018/11/30/ansible-on-fedora-30.html).

name: Lesser ist besser
body:
This release features:
- Tests on less version of Ansible.
- Updated documentation.

name: EC2 documented
body: If you want to test this role on AWS EC2, the readme helps you.

name: Moved selinux
body: SELinux packages are now moved to the selinux role, making this role simpler.

name: become_user allowed
body: To [allow become_user](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/become.html#becoming-an-unprivileged-user), setfacl has to be available. So, `acl` is now added.

name: Archlinux faster
body: The `-u` flag has been removed to prevent a full system update.

name: RHEL, SLES and Amazon Linux
body:
Since molecule testing on Amazon is implemented, I know RHEL, SLES and Amazon Linux are working. Cool, without any change to the role.

A lot of cleanups have also been done.

name: FreeBSD and faster
body:
FreeBSD has been added and tested locally, works like a charm.

FreeBSD can't be tested on Travis/in Docker, because Docker is kernel virtualization, and Linux has a different kernel than FreeBSD.

Futerhmore, mostly meta fixes and cleanups. This means this role is ready for Galaxy 3.0.3 with quality assessments.

name: Stars
body: Stars mostly.

name: community
body: Alpine now enable the community repository and installs shadow. Shadow is required for the user and group modules, so it's quite mandatory to have.

name: shadow
body: Removed shadow from Alpine, it's a community package, not available on all systems, like Vagrant.

name: Ansible 2.7
body:
As announced, Ansible 2.7 is out. This release makes sure this role runs on Ansible 2.7 too.

Also switch from `loop:` to not using loop or with items, because [Ansible got simpler again](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/porting_guides/porting_guide_2.7.html#using-a-loop-on-a-package-module-via-squash-actions)!

name: Ansible Fest 2018
body:
So, Ansible Fest 2018 inspired me to change my Ansible role strategy a bit. The changes include:
- Less Ansible versions tests.
- Add details to README.md
- Allow to update all packages installed by this role by setting `bootstrap_package_state:` to `latest`.
- Add a default molecule test to (locally) test all distributions at once.
- Fix Ansible Lint hints.
- Switch to (previously used) vars/main.yml instead of one file per distribution.

The role is now ready for 5 stars (quality check) on Galaxy 3.1!

name: state
body: Following the [best practices](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_best_practices.html#always-mention-the-state), which states that `state:` should be mentioned. So far most roles that used the default state, did not mention `state:`, but as it's a good practice, let's mention it from now on.

name: Don't wait
body: Not everybody wants to wait for the host to be up. It's still configurable with `bootstrap_wait_for_host: yes`, but the default is off.

name: inventory_hostsname
body: The `inventory_hostname` is always available, so no need to test is with a `when:`. Plus a space-fix.

name: Better wait
body: Waiting for a host in a better way, using ansible_ssh_host, ansible_host or inventory_hostname. Should work better with Vagrant too.

name: Readable
body: Updated the documentation to remove duplicate entries.

name: Wait and do not become
body:
Wait had and issue where `become: yes` was set for a `wait_for` action, that runs on localhost. That's not required, so explicitly set `become` to `no`.

Thanks @infothrill for your help!

name: Gentoo
body:
This role can now also be used to bootstrap (prepare a system to be managed by Ansible) [Gentoo](https://www.gentoo.org/).

Gentoo uses emerge, installing packages takes more time, but CI/CD seems to work.

name: Efficiency
body:
After quite some time, there were still a few improvements to do, breaking variable interface compatibility, so a major version bump:
- Fix: Typo in variable boostrap_wait_for_host -> bootstrap_wait_for_host.
- Change: Added package to support seport module.
- Change: Moved setup to a handler, more effecient.

name: Semantic Versioning
body: Ansible Galaxy required SemVer format versioning, deleted all releases and tags, starting with 1.0.0.
